questions.text: A 45-year-old man is brought to the emergency department in convulsive status epilepticus for the past 12 minutes. IV access is not yet available. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Wait for IV access and administer lorazepam 0.1 mg/kg

options.label: B
options.text: Administer intramuscular midazolam 10 mg immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Administer rectal diazepam 20 mg and observe

options.label: D
options.text: Start phenytoin infusion through nasogastric tube

questions.correct_answer: B. Administer intramuscular midazolam 10 mg immediately

questions.text: A 68-year-old man presents with sudden, violent, flinging movements of the right arm and leg. MRI reveals a small lacunar infarct. Which of the following brain structures is most likely involved?

options.label: A
options.text: Subthalamic nucleus

options.label: B
options.text: Globus pallidus internus

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior limb of internal capsule

options.label: D
options.text: Putamen

questions.correct_answer: A. Subthalamic nucleus

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB) is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients may show marked sensitivity to antipsychotic medications

options.label: B
options.text: Memory impairment is the earliest and most prominent feature

options.label: C
options.text: Visual hallucinations are a core clinical feature

options.label: D
options.text: Parkinsonism can develop concurrently or within a year of cognitive decline

questions.correct_answer: B. Memory impairment is the earliest and most prominent feature

questions.text: A 62-year-old right-handed man is brought to the ED after a stroke. He ignores people and objects on his left side and only eats food from the right side of his plate. He is alert and oriented but unaware of his deficits. Which of the following is the most likely site of the lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: Left parietal lobe

options.label: B
options.text: Left frontal eye field

options.label: C
options.text: Right inferior parietal lobule (non-dominant hemisphere)

options.label: D
options.text: Right occipital cortex

questions.correct_answer: C. Right inferior parietal lobule (non-dominant hemisphere)

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Anomic Aphasia is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients often use circumlocutions to describe objects they cannot name

options.label: B
options.text: Comprehension and repetition are typically preserved

options.label: C
options.text: Lesions may involve the angular gyrus or inferior temporal regions

options.label: D
options.text: Speech is non-fluent with poor grammar and frequent paraphasias

questions.correct_answer: D. Speech is non-fluent with poor grammar and frequent paraphasias

questions.text: A 64-year-old right-handed woman presents with sudden onset of fluent speech filled with paraphasias, poor comprehension, and intact motor strength. Which of the following vascular territories is most likely involved?

options.label: A
options.text: Left middle cerebral artery – inferior division

options.label: B
options.text: Right anterior cerebral artery – pericallosal branch

options.label: C
options.text: Left posterior cerebral artery – occipital branch

options.label: D
options.text: Right middle cerebral artery – superior division

questions.correct_answer: A. Left middle cerebral artery – inferior division

questions.text: A 68-year-old man presents to the ED with right-sided weakness and slurred speech that started 2 hours ago. CT head shows no hemorrhage. His blood pressure is 185/105 mmHg, and INR is 1.1. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer IV alteplase immediately

options.label: B
options.text: Start aspirin and monitor for neurological worsening

options.label: C
options.text: Lower BP to <185/110 mmHg before giving thrombolysis

options.label: D
options.text: Defer thrombolysis due to age and initiate supportive care

questions.correct_answer: C. Lower BP to <185/110 mmHg before giving thrombolysis

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH) is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Thunderclap headache is a classic presenting symptom

options.label: B
options.text: Non-contrast MRI is the initial investigation of choice

options.label: C
options.text: Xanthochromia in CSF can confirm SAH if CT is inconclusive

options.label: D
options.text: Nimodipine is used to prevent delayed cerebral ischemia

questions.correct_answer: B. Non-contrast MRI is the initial investigation of choice

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents after a stab wound to the right side of his thoracic spine. On examination, he has loss of motor function and proprioception on the right side, and loss of pain and temperature sensation on the left side below the lesion. Which of the following best explains these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral damage to the corticospinal tracts

options.label: B
options.text: Right-sided lesion of the dorsal column alone

options.label: C
options.text: Left-sided lesion of the spinothalamic tract at the same level

options.label: D
options.text: Right-sided hemisection of the spinal cord at the level of injury

questions.correct_answer: D. Right-sided hemisection of the spinal cord at the level of injury

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Myasthenia Gravis (MG) is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Deep tendon reflexes are typically diminished during a myasthenic crisis

options.label: B
options.text: It is commonly associated with thymic abnormalities

options.label: C
options.text: Symptoms typically worsen with exertion and improve with rest

options.label: D
options.text: Ptosis and diplopia are common presenting features

questions.correct_answer: A. Deep tendon reflexes are typically diminished during a myasthenic crisis

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of unilateral throbbing headache associated with photophobia and nausea, lasting for several hours. She experiences visual zigzag lines before the headache begins. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Migraine with aura

options.label: B
options.text: Tension-type headache

options.label: C
options.text: Cluster headache

options.label: D
options.text: Occipital lobe seizure

questions.correct_answer: A. Migraine with aura

questions.text: A 42-year-old man presents with low-grade fever, headache, and altered sensorium for 1 week. Fundus shows papilledema. CSF analysis reveals lymphocytic pleocytosis, elevated protein, and low glucose. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate lumbar puncture

options.label: B
options.text: Start empirical acyclovir therapy

options.label: C
options.text: Observe and lumbar puncture 24 hours

options.label: D
options.text: Perform neuroimaging before lumbar puncture

questions.correct_answer: D. Perform neuroimaging before lumbar puncture

questions.text: A 55-year-old chronic alcoholic is brought in with confusion, horizontal nystagmus, and wide-based gait. He is malnourished, and labs show low magnesium. Which of the following statements regarding his management is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Thiamine deficiency impairs glucose metabolism in the brain leading to lactic acidosis

options.label: B
options.text: IV dextrose should be started immediately to reverse energy deficiency

options.label: C
options.text: MRI may show bilateral medial thalamic hyperintensities

options.label: D
options.text: Hypomagnesemia may blunt response to thiamine therapy

questions.correct_answer: B. IV dextrose should be started immediately to reverse energy deficiency

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with amenorrhea and galactorrhea for 6 months. Serum prolactin is markedly elevated at 240 ng/mL. MRI reveals a 1.2 cm pituitary lesion. Which of the following is the most appropriate first-line treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Transsphenoidal surgical resection

options.label: B
options.text: Observation with serial prolactin levels

options.label: C
options.text: Radiotherapy targeting the sellar mass

options.label: D
options.text: Cabergoline therapy

questions.correct_answer: D. Cabergoline therapy

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with coarsening of facial features, enlarged hands, and excessive sweating. Serum IGF-1 is elevated. A 75g oral glucose GH suppression test shows a nadir GH level of 3.2 ng/mL. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Start somatostatin analog therapy immediately

options.label: B
options.text: Obtain contrast-enhanced MRI of the pituitary

options.label: C
options.text: Repeat IGF-1 testing after 6 months

options.label: D
options.text: Refer for transsphenoidal surgery without further imaging

questions.correct_answer: B. Obtain contrast-enhanced MRI of the pituitary

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presents with excessive thirst and urination. His serum sodium is 150 mEq/L, and serum osmolality is 305 mOsm/kg. Urine osmolality is low at 120 mOsm/kg. After administration of desmopressin, urine osmolality increases to 450 mOsm/kg. Which of the following statements is INCORRECT regarding Diabetes Insipidus?

options.label: A
options.text: Central DI is characterized by deficiency of antidiuretic hormone (ADH)

options.label: B
options.text: Nephrogenic DI shows minimal or no response to desmopressin

options.label: C
options.text: Desmopressin challenge test helps differentiate between central and nephrogenic DI

options.label: D
options.text: Complete central DI typically shows no change in urine osmolality after desmopressin

questions.correct_answer: D. Complete central DI typically shows no change in urine osmolality after desmopressin

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with small cell lung carcinoma presents with confusion and lethargy. Labs show: • Serum sodium: 118 mEq/L • Serum osmolality: 260 mOsm/kg • Urine sodium: 45 mEq/L • Urine osmolality: 500 mOsm/kg He is euvolemic on examination. Which of the following findings is most consistent with SIADH?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypernatremia with dilute urine

options.label: B
options.text: Low urine sodium with high serum osmolality

options.label: C
options.text: Inappropriately concentrated urine despite hyponatremia

options.label: D
options.text: Hypovolemia with orthostatic hypotension and low JVP

questions.correct_answer: C. Inappropriately concentrated urine despite hyponatremia

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman presents with weight gain, facial rounding, purple striae, and proximal muscle weakness. Her 1 mg overnight dexamethasone suppression test fails to suppress serum cortisol. Plasma ACTH is low. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Adrenal adenoma producing cortisol

options.label: B
options.text: Ectopic ACTH secretion from a bronchial carcinoid

options.label: C
options.text: Cushing disease due to pituitary ACTH adenoma

options.label: D
options.text: Exogenous corticosteroid use

questions.correct_answer: A. Adrenal adenoma producing cortisol

questions.text: A 25-year-old type 1 diabetic presents with abdominal pain, vomiting, and rapid breathing. Labs show: • pH: 7.12 • HCO₃⁻: 10 mEq/L • Blood glucose: 480 mg/dL • Serum ketones: positive • Anion gap: 24 Which of the following statements regarding the management of DKA is INCORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: Initial fluid resuscitation is started with isotonic saline

options.label: B
options.text: Bicarbonate therapy is recommended routinely if pH is below 7.3

options.label: C
options.text: Insulin infusion should be started after initial volume resuscitation

options.label: D
options.text: Potassium should be monitored closely and replaced even if serum levels are initially normal

questions.correct_answer: B. Bicarbonate therapy is recommended routinely if pH is below 7.3

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman presents with fatigue, cold intolerance, and weight gain. Labs reveal TSH of 22 µIU/mL and free T4 below normal. She is started on levothyroxine. Which of the following is the most appropriate approach to management?

options.label: A
options.text: Start combination therapy with T3 and T4 for faster symptom control

options.label: B
options.text: Start high-dose levothyroxine (200 mcg/day) to normalize levels quickly

options.label: C
options.text: Repeat TFTs after 3 days to adjust dose based on early response

options.label: D
options.text: Start low-to-moderate dose levothyroxine and recheck TSH in 6–8 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Start low-to-moderate dose levothyroxine and recheck TSH in 6–8 weeks
